page.title: 13Local History in Chalton
page.content: {Manor farm in the centre of Chalton}is {the home of Mr. Budden.}It is built on the site of a{13 Century building}that burnt down and was replaced c.14 Cent. by a timberframed flint and stone house.Research by Mr.Budden and Prof. B. Cuniliff in 1968 has shown that additions and changes took place in 15 and 16 centuries. The walls are now of flint or brick and are solid. A lot of the original sand and lime plaster is still left. The original East wall is now under the garden and was excavated in 1968. In a room that use to be the kitchen,is a large Inglenook fireplace with large bread ovens on either side. In the wall of a living room Mr. John Budden has exposed a 13 C. window. It is like a church window with iron bars across it. Much{Medieval and Saxon {pottery has also been found both at {the farm and in the Village.
